description.value:
>@UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.themes.Item.88GXIJXlSIcfD4nw]{Gladiator}

Your name is synonymous with your gladiatorial persona and outfit. As long as your gear is in good condition, you don't take any circumstantial penalties for wearing light armor or heavy armor in social situations (such as wearing @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.equipment.Item.FsG9CybUFmd3G0em]{golemforged plate} to a formal event). You can use @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.6fqgiVqlA7u9jS4i]{Intimidate} or @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.bD4kmdFU7wwsenOf]{Profession (gladiator; Charisma)} to "hide" up to two smaller weapons (such as a small arm or one-handed melee weapon with light bulk) or one larger melee weapon on your body, though you do not conceal the weapon so much as convince others to accept your carrying it without any objections. You can draw these weapons as normal; you do not need to spend a standard action as you would to draw a hidden weapon. Otherwise, this functions as the @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.qVEW9HjXQN0ok879#hide-object]{hide object} task of @UUID[Compendium.sfrpg.rules.JournalEntry.GMkLZsN3a7YPvA03.JournalEntryPage.qVEW9HjXQN0ok879]{Sleight of Hand}. At the GM's discretion, areas with especially high security may not allow you to carry weapons at all, no matter your reputation.
